text: I'm once again taking advantage of the
citrus season and this time it's for a
desert tangerine bundt cake with a
tangerine glaze we need a half a cup of
juice for the cake plus a couple more
tablespoons for the glaze and you'll
need about two tablespoons of zest well
you have your tangerines prepped you can
move right along to your dry ingredients
whisk together three cups of all-purpose
flour with a teaspoon of baking soda and
a teaspoon of salt when that's ready you
can start creaming I have two sticks of
butter in my mixer to that add two cups
of granulated sugar and let it cream the
butter should be room temp so it creams
up really quickly
make sure that it gets nice and light
and fluffy before you start adding your
eggs you'll need 6 large eggs add the
eggs one at a time I've already cracked
mine into a measuring cup and they'll
drop one at a time into the mixer roll
it's a handy dandy trick as long as you
don't pour too thick then you can add 2
tablespoons of grated tangerines s 2
tablespoons of an orange flavored
liqueur this just bumps up the flavor a
little bit but I think it adds a little
bit of a extra orange enos and then also
a teaspoon of vanilla
but I like to add my liquids alternating
with my dry ingredients I have a half a
cup of tangerine juice as well as 3/4 of
a cup of plain yogurt start off by
adding a third of your flour you don't
need to be too exact here I suppose it's
not completely crucial but it's just
better technique
remaining tangerine juice can go in as
well and the rest of the yogurt
final edition of flower goes in and then
beat everything till it's fully combined
have your oven preheating to 350 degrees
I have a 12 cup bundt pan here I've
buttered and floured it so that it's
virtually nonstick it's already a
nonstick pan but I like to play it safe
when it comes to my cakes this is a
pretty big cake batter so I like to take
it off of the mixer for one final stir
to make sure it's fully combines all
righty good fully combined pour it into
your pan you can even out the top it
does even itself out in the oven but I
always like to start it off as evenly as
possible get it into your oven and bake
it until a cake tester inserted in the
center comes out clean it'll take about
55 to 60 minutes when your cake comes
out of the oven let it cool in the pan
for about 30 minutes then turn it on on
to a rack and let it cool completely
that'll take maybe another 30 minutes
maybe even an hour so let it get nice
and cool before you make the glaze this
is one and a half cups of confectioner's
sugar and to that add about three
tablespoons of tangerine juice it may be
a little more it may be a little less so
add it gradually I've had entire glazes
ruined by adding too much liquid all at
once you can always add more but you
can't take it back which seems like it's
probably going to be the exact right
amount it's a little too thick and it's
too thick to spoon over your cake you
can either add more tangerine juice if
you have more tangerines or just a tiny
bit of milk or water
here's my cold cake a beautiful golden
color holds the shape of the pan really
really nicely then you can spoon the
glaze over the top and let it drip down
the sides I have this still sitting on
the wire rack that I cooled it on and
some of the glaze is falling into the
pan beneath you can always scrape up the
glaze from the bottom of the pan and
reglazed your cake with that if you feel
like it needs an additional layering now
of course you're going to want to let
this sit for the glaze to set before you
cut into it otherwise it'll be a gooey
mess so let it sit for about thirty
minutes to an hour for the glaze to
completely set all right uh-huh what do
you think do you want to try it as much
as I do
haha you can't you can you can make this
at home it's really really easy and I
know you're gonna enjoy it as much as I
do look at that golden color on the
inside that's all from that tangerine
juice hmm its moist it's got great
flavor from the zest and the juice and
the glaze it's a fantastic cake you and
your friends are gonna enjoy I don't
know
I'm imperfect with a cup of tea
